reviews.review: This is THE way to spend time. I highly recommend Half Life: Opposing Force.
You can shoot people in it
Very nostalgic, adds fun new weapons and enemies compared to Half-Life, definitely worth it if you want more Half-Life action.
Expande de buena manera la jugabilidad, muy recomendable

buy it or die without it
best best best best best best best best best best best best game ever
tek oturu≈üta bitirdim 9 saat yazƒ±yor nasƒ±l ge√ßti emin deƒüilim muazzam

A pesar de no lograr llegar al nivel de magnificencia del half life original, expande la idea y el universo de HL lo suficiente como para atraparte y llamarte la atenci√≥n hasta el final. Vale la pena si lo encuentras en rebajas o en bundle.

Un buen juego pero no a la altura de Half-life. Algo que lo diferencia de su hermano mayor es que se enfoca mas en el combate, aunque la variedad de enemigos no es mucha y si bien hay muchas armas a elegir, la munici√≥n jamas se te acaba. Aparte que es mucho mas corto y el final junto con el jefe son sumamente decepcionantes. Solo recomendado para fan√°ticos hardcore de la franquicia. Si no lo juegas, no te pierdes de mucho.

Una muy buena expasi√≥n del juego original; incluso me atrever√≠a a decir que es mucho mejor que los otros 2 existentes. No obstante con eso, tiene un multijugador mucho mejor que el original ¬°J U E G A Z O!
nice game it is very fun sometimes a little angry but very fun.
Have to recommend anything in the HL series.  While Blue Shift and Opposing Force aren't as good as the original, they're still good.

es un juego bastante entretenido,unas 5 casi 6 horas de juego si vas despacio,se disfruta bastante aunque no llegue como a otros half life pero los gr√°ficos para ser del 2000 est√°n bastante bien,le supera a blue shift con mucha diferencia en terminos de gameplay,pero blue shift le supera en gr√°ficos,hay muchas nuevas mec√°nicas en el y aunque no se considere canon,se ve aprovechable para una entrega nueva de half life,el multijugador es inservible,solo hay bots y hay alg√∫n que otro error en el audio del juego,mezclando ingl√©s con espa√±ol pero yo le doy un 8/10

My only issue is it was advertised as "you play as the villain" but Mr. Shephard over here doesn't even get the orders to shoot the scientists! I was expecting to be running around gunning down Barneys! Not that I'd want that..
Great dlc, it fits right in without copying too much (although the basic premise is basically the same as the main story). Introduces cool new monsters and weapons.
Juego recomendable si te interesa adentrarte un poquito m√°s en el lore de Half Life

I love the idea that Valve decided to put a new alien race in the game to fight against. Race X, these are total bada**es. I also enjoy the fact that I'm playing with a new protagonist here - Corporal Shephard. Let Gordon Freeman have a break for now. It's Adrian Shephard's turn to kick aliens' butt.

Opposing Force takes a very much different views. Unlike the main game, you play as the soldier who is a good guy and his only goal is to survive and escape the Black Mesa incident without being heavily drawn to a Black Ops Division. The game has new weapons from Desert Eagle, LMG and several weapons that I failed to mention.

Bottom line is, Opposing Force is just okay and repetitive to me, but still delivered an impressive version than Blue Shift.

7/10

[h1]Old but Good.[/h1]

Pretty good game even in the recent year of 2020. Only complaint that I have is the lack of direction in some maps. but that could just be my small brain not figuring out things a normal human being would. either way, great game 10/10.

Half-Life: Opposing Force is a damn good expansion. It features even more weapons than Half-Life 1, and the action hasn't been toned down, either. The introduction of incredibly interesting weapons (the displacer, especially), Race X (an alien faction besides the Xen), and interactions between the Black Mesa staff, Black Ops units, and our military boys, all serve to cement OF's place as an incredible game, perhaps even as a stand-alone experience.
Really not the dollar you want to spend

It is a very fun game to play. It takes what you love from half life and remakes it into a unique point of view during the black mesa incident. It is as good as the first one.
Cool game, altough not likely I hope to see Shephard again in some other Half-Life game.
the best expansion to half life!
Short af but a great way to expand the original Half-Life story and to give a new pov into Black Mesa events.

I can guarantee that it's the best expansion of half life. The story is so good when you see everything through the eyes of a soldier called Adrian Shephard. The game adds so many weapons and they are all fun. I really don't know what to say about the edning, like it's good, but there is something to it that makes you even more interested in A.Shephard's story. I really hope that we will see Shephard in another half life game :]]]]]
fucking amazing bro adrian is so sexy bro
Badly paced, badly written. Just overall bad, as if they haven't played the base game.
its fun and difficult and you can get easily lost on what to do

I Love this expansion. It links a bit to the original, it doesn't Force (lol) you to kill the npc's because Technically you aren't given any orders, and the combat is Sweet. I mean it is an interesting perspective that you were sent in, have to escape, and then the people that sent you in try to kill You. This Whole Place is out of control! It goes Way beyond FUBAR. 

It could have been longer, like the Gordon storyline, but it makes some sense because you wake up like 4 hours into the events in an EA-Excuse kind of way, right about 40% of the Gordon line. There is not really any Xen which is disappointing, but the new enemies are interesting and the guns are nice. Not much use for the Sniper really, because the maps were all small. Now that I think about it the ending was probably rushed and they cut the boss in half and cut out Xen. I also love my squiddy.

Anyway, it's worth a play, and MAKE SURE TO PLAY BOOTCAMP. It's awesome in itself because it takes you on a 20 minute training exercise that is also Totally unique and you get a sight of G-Man.
esta bueno para entretenerse un rato :v
muito bom , √© que nem HL1 s√≥ que com outra hist√≥ria no mesmo mundo

If someone liked Half-Life, they should probably take this one as well.
There are some more challenging fights than in the base game, but the gameplay remains solid, and the narrative extends upon the events around Black Mesa.
Hint: the grappling hook thingy should be used on the green pods to reach places.

WHO THE FUCK IS A SOLDIER FROM MY PLATOON AND CAN SOMEBODY TELL THEM IF THEY'VE SEEN THEM.
Bonne extension du jeu de base
It's Half-Life, what do you think? Of course, it's good. Why even think it's not?

this expansion is one of the two good games to come out of gearbox.

opposing force contains plenty of brand new weapons, enemies, and varied environments and perspectives not seen in the original game. all of these new weapons are somehow so seamlessly integrated into the game i cant see it without them.

the game features a few standard firearms as new weapons, like an m249 and the deagle, but most of the new additions are extremely unique, like the barnacle which functions like an organic grappling hook, or the spore launcher which is just an alien you feed candy to "reload", and squeeze to "fire" (depending on which came first this may be either a reference to, or inspiration for a weapon in the poke646 duo of mods for half life)

overall, this expansion is one of the shining examples of what an expansion should do. it EXPANDS on the base game and offers unique and memorable experiences unlike anything else of its time (except for half life, of course).

*deep breathes in* Masta... *breaths out*PEICE. AKA this is amazing as it always was. it was never confusing was never boring and was the opposite of Blue Shift...

Ho apprezzato molto la prima met√† di Opposing Force, che alterna puzzle e scontri a fuoco in modo omogeneo in modo molto simile al capitolo principale.
Anche qui, dopo aver introdotto il nuovo nemico, si inizia a sparare fin troppo, lasciando fin troppo in disparte i puzzle, e tornando alla struttura ripetitiva delle sezioni finali di Half-Life.

7/10
